t: Matthew 1
The Genealogy of Jesus Christ
An*p account of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the Son of David, the Son of Abraham:
From Abraham to David
Abraham*ln fathered Isaac, Isaac*ln fathered Jacob, Jacob*ln fathered Judah and his brothers,
Judah*ln fathered Perez and Zerah by Tamar, Perez*ln fathered Hezron, Hezron*ln fathered Aram,
Aram*ln fathered Amminadab, Amminadab*ln fathered Nahshon, Nahshon*ln fathered Salmon,
Salmon*ln fathered Boaz by Rahab, Boaz*ln fathered Obed by Ruth, Obed*ln fathered Jesse,
and*ln Jesse fathered King David.
From David to the Babylonian Exile
David*ln fathered Solomon by Uriah’s wife,
Solomon*ln fathered Rehoboam, Rehoboam*ln fathered Abijah, Abijah*ln fathered Asa,
Asa*ln fathered Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat*ln fathered Joram, Joram*ln fathered Uzziah,
Uzziah*ln fathered Jotham, Jotham*ln fathered Ahaz, Ahaz*ln fathered Hezekiah,
Hezekiah*ln fathered Manasseh, Manasseh*ln fathered Amon, Amon*ln fathered Josiah,
and*ln Josiah fathered Jeconiah and his brothers at*ln the time of the exile to Babylon.
From the Exile to the Messiah
After*ln the exile to Babylon Jeconiah*ln fathered Shealtiel, Shealtiel*ln fathered Zerubbabel,
Zerubbabel*ln fathered Abiud, Abiud*ln fathered Eliakim, Eliakim*ln fathered Azor,
Azor*ln fathered Zadok, Zadok*ln fathered Achim, Achim*ln fathered Eliud,
Eliud*ln fathered Eleazar, Eleazar*ln fathered Matthan, Matthan*ln fathered Jacob,
and*ln Jacob fathered Joseph the husband of Mary, who*ln gave birth to Jesus who is called the Messiah.

So*p all the generations from Abraham to David were fourteen generations; and from David until the exile to Babylon, fourteen generations; and from the exile to Babylon until the Messiah, fourteen generations.
The Nativity of the Messiah
The*p birth of Jesus Christ came about this way: After his mother Mary had been engaged to Joseph, it was discovered before they came together that she was pregnant from the Holy Spirit.
So her husband, Joseph, being a righteous man, and not wanting to disgrace her publicly, decided to divorce her secretly.

But*p after he had considered these things, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, “Joseph, son of David, don’t be afraid to take Mary as your wife, because what has been conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.
She will give birth to a son, and you are to name him Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins.”
Now*p all this took place to fulfill what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet:
See,*ipn the*i virgin*i will*i become*i pregnant*i and*iln give*i birth*i to*i a*i son,*i and*iln they*i will*i name*i him*i Immanuel,*i which*p is translated “God is with us.”
When*p Joseph woke up, he did as the Lord’s angel had commanded him. He married her
but did not have sexual relations with her until she gave birth to a son. And he named him Jesus.
